Package com.dumbdogdiner.stickyapi.bukkit.particle

Class ParticleSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dumbdogdiner.stickyapi.bukkit.particle.ParticleSystem
  • public class ParticleSystem
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages the spawning and animation of particles.
    Since:
    2.0

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private org.bukkit.Particle.DustOptions data
      The default dust options to use when drawing.
      private @Nullable org.bukkit.Particle particle
      The default particle to use when drawing.
      private @NotNull org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin
      The plugin this particle system is attached to.
      private org.bukkit.Location root
      The relative root of this system.
      private @NotNull org.bukkit.World world
      The world this particle system is contained in.

      • plugin

        @NotNull
private final @NotNull org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin
        The plugin this particle system is attached to.

      • world

        @NotNull
private final @NotNull org.bukkit.World world
        The world this particle system is contained in.

      • root

        private org.bukkit.Location root
        The relative root of this system. Calling non-absolute methods target the system to spawn relative to this location.

      • particle

        @Nullable
private @Nullable org.bukkit.Particle particle
        The default particle to use when drawing.

      • data

        @Nullable
private org.bukkit.Particle.DustOptions data
        The default dust options to use when drawing.

      • spawn

        public ParticleSystem spawn​(@NotNull
                            @NotNull org.bukkit.Particle particle,
                            double x,
                            double y,
                            double z,
                            int count,
                            @Nullable
                            org.bukkit.Particle.DustOptions data)
        Spawn particles at the target co-ordinates, relative to the root of the system. Summoning particles at (0,0,0) refers to (root_x, root_y, root_z) relative to world origin.
        Parameters:
        particle - The type of particle to spawn
        x - The x co-ordinate relative to the system root
        y - The y co-ordinate relative to the system root
        z - The z co-ordinate relative to the system root
        count - The number of particles to spawn
        data - Data of the particles to spawn
        Returns:
        ParticleSystem

                                    @NotNull org.bukkit.Particle particle,
                                    double x,
                                    double y,
                                    double z,
                                    int count,
                                    @Nullable
                                    org.bukkit.Particle.DustOptions data)
        Spawn particles at the absolute target co-ordinates. Summoning particles at (0,0,0) refers to (0, 0, 0) relative to world origin.
        Parameters:
        particle - The type of particle to spawn

        y - The absolute y co-ordinate
        z - The absolute z co-ordinate
        count - The number of particles to spawn

        ParticleSystem

      • parametric

        public ParticleSystem parametric​(@NotNull
                                 @NotNull org.bukkit.Particle particle,
                                 @NotNull
                                 @NotNull Parametric parametric,
                                 double t0,
                                 double t1,
                                 double stepSize,
                                 int count,
                                 @Nullable
                                 org.bukkit.Particle.DustOptions data)
        Spawn particles in the shape of a parametric curve. Summoning particles at (0,0,0) refers to (root_x, root_y, root_z) relative to world origin.
        Parameters:
        particle - The type of particle to spawn
        parametric - The curve to follow
        t0 - The initial value of t
        t1 - The final value of t
        stepSize - The size of steps made in-between t0 and t1
        count - The number of particles to spawn per stepSize
        data - Data of the particles to spawn
        Returns:
        ParticleSystem

      • line

        public ParticleSystem line​(@NotNull
                           @NotNull org.bukkit.Particle particle,
                           double x1,
                           double y1,
                           double z1,
                           double x2,
                           double y2,
                           double z2,
                           double steps,
                           int count,
                           @Nullable
                           org.bukkit.Particle.DustOptions data)
        Draw a straight line between the specified relative co-ordinates.
        Parameters:
        particle - The type of particle to spawn
        x1 - The x co-ordinate of point a relative to the system root
        y1 - The y co-ordinate of point a relative to the system root
        z1 - The z co-ordinate of point a relative to the system root
        x2 - The x co-ordinate of point b relative to the system root
        y2 - The y co-ordinate of point b relative to the system root
        z2 - The z co-ordinate of point b relative to the system root
        steps - The number of steps to take drawing the line
        count - The number of particles to spawn per step
        data - Data of the particles to spawn
        Returns:
        ParticleSystem
